title: 820-2849, fan spins for 2 seconds in a loop
message:
Macbook 17", customer says computer was heating up and randomly shutting down. He went to an Apple partner store, apparently only give a format to the computer and return it to the customer, he is not sure if something else was done to the macbook. As usual they try to sell him a new machine. 
After the Macbook was return he didn't have his data in the drive (that's why we think they give a format or reinstall the OS), macbook work fine for a couple of hours, then it start heating, fan spin very loud then it turns of.
After heating up, customer let it rest for 1 day. Next day computer turns on for few minutes and then turn off, after a couple of times macbook stop booting.

Now computer spin the fan for a few seconds and turns off, does this in a loop, if macbook is cold fan spins longer.
PPBUS_G3H is 8.4 Volts, not sure what to expect in this line, is my first time working in this model and diagram says "6V"
All S5 rails are fine
PP5V_S3 up to VCore are pulsating, shows normal voltage for a couple of seconds and then go to 0V. 

Any ideas? 
Or should I skip this one?

title: 820-2849, fan spins for 2 seconds in a loop
message:
Board stays on if RAM module removed?
If yes, could have bad GPU; heat it for test...

title: 820-2849, fan spins for 2 seconds in a loop
message:
Boards stays on with RAM removed.

I try another RAM, that I know are good, and same problem. Fan only spins for a couple of seconds.

title: 820-2849, fan spins for 2 seconds in a loop
message:
GPU seems to be heated up in the past, also both GPU and CPU have and awful kind and amount of termal grease.
After cleaning that mess, in the microscope I see a little damage in a corner of the GPU die.
Is posible to disable the NVIDIA GPU in this model?

title: 820-2849, fan spins for 2 seconds in a loop
820-2849, fan spins for 2 seconds in a loop
message:
Ok.
This one is a no fix.
Thanks for the info
